contentrichtext.text: '''Heaven and Hell''' may refer to: {{TOC right}} * [[Heaven]] and [[Hell]] ==Literature== * [[Heaven and Hell (Allan Kardec)|''Heaven and Hell'' (Allan Kardec)]], a book by Allan Kardec * [[Heaven and Hell (essay)|''Heaven and Hell'' (essay)]], a book by Aldous Huxley, sequel to ''The Doors of Perception'' * [[Heaven and Hell (novel)|''Heaven and Hell'' (novel)]], a 1987 novel by John Jakes * [[Heaven and Hell (Swedenborg)|''Heaven and Hell'' (Swedenborg)]], a book by Emanuel Swedenborg * ''[[Heaven and Hell: My Life in the Eagles (1974–2001)]]'', a book by Don Felder * [[Heaven and Hell (play)|''Heaven and Hell'' (play)]], a play by [[Dusty Hughes (playwright)|Dusty Hughes]] ==Music== * [[Heaven & Hell (band)]], a band with members of Black Sabbath ===Albums=== * [[Heaven and Hell (Black Sabbath album)|''Heaven and Hell'' (Black Sabbath album)]], or the title song (see below) * [[Heaven & Hell (Devolo album)|''Heaven & Hell'' (Devolo album)]], or the title song * [[Heaven & Hell (Joe Jackson album)|''Heaven & Hell'' (Joe Jackson album)]] * [[Heaven & Hell (Meat Loaf and Bonnie Tyler album)|''Heaven & Hell'' (Meat Loaf and Bonnie Tyler album)]] * [[Heaven & Hell (Shin Terai album)|''Heaven & Hell'' (Shin Terai album)]] * [[Heaven and Hell (Systems in Blue album)|''Heaven and Hell'' (Systems in Blue album)]], or the title song (see below) * [[Heaven and Hell (Vangelis album)|''Heaven and Hell'' (Vangelis album)]], or the title song * ''[[Heaven & Hell – A Tribute to The Velvet Underground]]'', a series of albums ===Songs=== * [[Heaven and Hell (Black Sabbath song)|"Heaven and Hell" (Black Sabbath song)]], 1980 * [[Heaven and Hell (Systems in Blue song)|"Heaven and Hell" (Systems in Blue song)]], 2009 * [[Heaven and Hell (The Who song)|"Heaven and Hell" (The Who song)]], 1970, also recorded by John Entwistle * [[Heaven & Hell (Raekwon song)|"Heaven & Hell" (Raekwon song)]], 1994 * "Heaven and Hell", a song by Annie from ''[[Don't Stop (Annie album)|Don't Stop]]'', 2009 * "Heaven and Hell", a song by C. C. Catch from ''[[Welcome to the Heartbreak Hotel]]'', 1986 * "Heaven & Hell", a song by The Easybeats released as a 1967 single and on the album ''[[Best of The Easybeats – Volume 2]]'', 1969 * "Heaven and Hell", a song by Flower Travellin' Band from ''[[Made in Japan (Flower Travellin' Band album)|Made in Japan]]'', 1972 ==Film and television== * [[High and Low (1963 film)|''High and Low'' (1963 film)]] (''Tengoku to Jigoku'', literally ''Heaven and Hell''), a 1963 movie by Akira Kurosawa * [[Heaven and Hell (film)|''Heaven and Hell'' (film)]], a 1980 Hong Kong [[List of Shaw Brothers films#1980|film produced by Shaw Brothers Studio]] * "Heaven and Hell", an episode of ''[[Decoding the Past]]'' * "Heaven and Hell", an episode of ''[[Mysteries of the Bible#Season 3|Mysteries of the Bible]]'' * [[Heaven and Hell (Supernatural)|"Heaven and Hell" (''Supernatural'')]], an episode of the television series ''Supernatural'' * ''Jeremy Clarkson: Heaven and Hell'', a 2005 DVD by [[Jeremy Clarkson]] <!-- Commented out because not supported by linked article: * ''Heaven & Hell: North & South, Book III'', a 1994 television miniseries in the [[North and South (TV miniseries)| ]] trilogy --> ==See also== * ''[[The Marriage of Heaven and Hell]]'', an 18th-century book by William Blake * [[Heaven or Hell (disambiguation)]] * [[Heaven (disambiguation)]] * [[Hell (disambiguation)]] {{disambig}}
